title: DRAGON Score for Post-TPA Stroke Outcome
description: Predicts 3-month outcome (functional independence vs dependency) in ischemic stroke patients treated with tissue plasminogen activator (tPA). Helps identify patients who may benefit from additional therapeutic interventions.

parameters.name: hyperdense_artery_infarct
parameters.description: Hyperdense cerebral artery sign or early infarct signs on admission CT scan

parameters.name: prestroke_mrs
parameters.description: Pre-stroke modified Rankin Scale (mRS) score greater than 1

parameters.name: onset_to_treatment
parameters.description: Time from symptom onset to treatment initiation

parameters.name: nihss
parameters.description: Baseline National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) score

result.name: dragon_score
result.description: DRAGON score (0-10 points) predicting stroke outcome

ranges.interpretation: 96% chance of good outcome (mRS 0-2 at 3 months). Excellent functional prognosis with near-certain functional independence.
88% chance of good outcome (mRS 0-2 at 3 months). Good functional prognosis with high likelihood of functional independence.
74% chance of good outcome (mRS 0-2 at 3 months). Moderate functional prognosis with considerable chance of functional independence.
Progressively decreasing chance of good outcome. Consider additional therapeutic interventions or advanced stroke care strategies.
0% chance of good outcome (mRS 0-2). 70% chance of miserable outcome (mRS 5-6). Strong consideration for additional rescue therapies.
0% chance of good outcome (mRS 0-2). 100% chance of miserable outcome (mRS 5-6: bedridden, incontinent, requiring constant care, or death).

references: Strbian D, Meretoja A, Ahlhelm FJ, et al. Predicting outcome of IV thrombolysis-treated ischemic stroke patients: the DRAGON score. Neurology. 2012;78(6):427-432. doi: 10.1212/WNL.0b013e318245d2a9.

formula: DRAGON Score = D (Dense artery/early infarct: 0-2) + R (mRS >1: 0-1) + A (Age: 0-2) + G (Glucose >144 mg/dL: 0-1) + O (Onset >90 min: 0-1) + N (NIHSS: 0-3)
notes: The DRAGON score uses only information available shortly after hospital arrival
Higher scores indicate worse prognosis and lower likelihood of functional independence
Score helps identify patients who may benefit from additional therapeutic interventions
Not yet validated in prospective studies, based on retrospective analyses
AUC-ROC consistently around 0.84 in validation studies
May not be applicable to patients with basilar artery occlusion
Most useful for patients receiving IV tPA treatment within treatment window
